cyclone.name: MARCO
cyclone.current_location: about 240 miles SSE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing NNW today, then turning NW-WNW toward the southeast Louisiana coast; forecast to skim or cross the coastline Monday afternoon and then track westward along the Louisiana coast through Tuesday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast near the Mouth of the Mississippi River–Morgan City corridor

weather_observation.watch_coast: No active TC watches for the port; nearby Storm Surge Watch extends Sabine Pass TX to Morgan City LA and east of Ocean Springs MS to Mississippi/Alabama border.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Morgan City LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River; Storm Surge Warning Morgan City LA to Ocean Springs MS including Lake Borgne.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast Louisiana coastline including Plaquemines Parish, Lake Pontchartrain/Maurepas, and Mississippi barrier islands.
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force gusts (75–80 mph possible) Monday afternoon/evening; sustained tropical-storm winds likely.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation 4–6 ft above ground for the lower Mississippi River delta including Plaquemines Parish.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated pockets up to 7 inches, leading to flash/urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornado risk beginning early Monday.
